review_title: Returned to Work at Nord a Second Time
pros: Amazing mission and service to the community. Team environment. On-site fitness room. Many talented and nice co-workers.
cons: Community mental health can be a challenging environment due to resource limitations and payor requirements.

pros: Meetings with supervisors was helpful. Friendly atmosphere.
cons: Pay not fair for amount of work put in.

job_title: Peer Support Specialist in Lorain, OH
pros: You work with some great coworkers but career progression isn’t based on merit. More like a popularity contest. The clients are the best part of the job and some management are genuine.
cons: The wages are so low that you struggle to survive which is relatable to the clients.

pros: The clients that are receiving care.
cons: Management over the residential aides are very Unprofessional. Out of a group of five there was only one that could be trusted.

pros: Flexible with time / location close to home

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Lorain, OH
pros: Good amount of PTO, easy to pick up hours
cons: Toxic work environment, no flexibility, no support, no communication, rules seem to randomly change

pros: Diverse clientele, mostly have control over your schedule (though that was changing when I left), kind co-workers, able to work as a team
cons: Mostly functional supervision (rather than clinical training or support), required to work evenings, micro-management from some supervisors

review_title: Not a caring employer for 24 hour employees
job_title: Licensed Social Worker in Lorain, OH
pros: pay is decent for the county. accrued holiday is pretty cool. majorily women which is cool. anyone who works on the outpatient side has it made. 9-5 no holidays etc.
cons: if you work 24 hour services, it is extremely taxing. CEO does not care about people at this work place. deemed this department "low risk" for COVID-19 exposure... we go to hospitals, peoples homes, schools, homeless shelters, jails etc. MASSIVE involvement in the community. NO PAY RAISES. very poor allocation of funds and ability to treat 24 hour team as essential. The entire company is structured around emergency services and they treat those services as everyones fool.

pros: co-workers could be the best or the worse and management has a hands off policy towards racism
cons: High Stress but pay is not worth it

pros: Decent pay and client care experience
cons: Disorganized and poor work life balance

job_title: Peer Support Specialist in Lorain, OH
pros: Great work experience with some great coworkers.
cons: Seems to be growing too fast to stay focused

pros: The Nord Center employs wonderful, compassionate people who are a blessing to be around. The agency offers flexible work hours and casual Fridays. The management team is supportive, and listens to suggestions from staff. Of course the feel good effect from working at a non-profit making a difference in the lives of others can't be beat.
cons: The biggest con to working at The Nord Center is the compensation. Being a Lorain County agency, the salaries are typically less than the Cuyahoga County counterparts.

review_title: Great place to work and grow
pros:
-Increased clinical skills
-Opportunities for growth in career
-Amazing co-workers
-Great supervisors who are available and supportive 
-Fitness room availability
-Food at monthly all-staff meetings
-Fun agency wide competitions: penny wars, wearing sports teams colors
-Supports various causes such as child abuse awareness, mental health month
-Kiosks and phones for clients to use
-Ways of recognizing hard work by other co-workers, which allows for agency wide acknowledgement
-All agency picnics and parties are great
-A lot of employees that have longevity with agency
-Handles changes and difficulties head-on 
-Interim CEO is passionate about the organization and is sensitive to diversity issues
cons:
-periods of high turnovers (nature of the industry)
-segregation between departments

pros: Clients were mostly wonderful.  Caring clinicians who really want to help.
cons: Higher ups were only concerned about finances under new CEO.  This is difficult with a mental health facility.   There was an incredibly high turnover and extreme stress everyone was under.  Also, expected to perform new tasks with little to no training,

review_title: Job is challenging and rewarding but management is lack luster.
pros:
Working w clients
Pay is above average
No work at home
Overtime as needed
cons:
Management taking things personally 
Not enough people to work

pros: great mission for the people that need it most
cons: poor management and difficult finances; just not enough money.
